message_1: A company needs to transport 1200 units of product from factory A to factory B through a network of 5 interconnected routes. The maximum capacity of each route is 400 units. Determine the minimum number of trips that the company must make to transport all the product from A to B.
message_2:
To determine the minimum number of trips needed to transport all 1200 units of product, we can divide the total number of units by the maximum capacity of each route:

1200 units / 400 units per trip = 3 trips

So, the company must make a minimum of 3 trips to transport all the product from factory A to factory B.
